intro: Chamaesyce nutans, commonly known as the nodding sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent, often arranged in a rosette pattern, and are adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Chamaesyce nutans is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, sun-exposed conditions.
